cheatsheet.title: Creating a new g-Eclipse Grid Project

intro.description: This cheat sheet will show you how to create a new g-Eclipse Grid Project.

item.title: Open the g-Eclipse user perspective
item.description: If you are not already in the g-Eclipse user perspective, in the main menu select Window > Open Perspective > g-Eclipse (User) or click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

item.title: Select the Grid Project View
item.description: Select the Grid Project View on your g-Eclipse Workbench.

item.title: Launch the Grid Project Wizard
item.description: Right-click into that view and select New > Grid Project to launch the wizard.

item.title: Basic Information
item.description: Step through the pages in the Grid Project Wizard.
item.subitem: Specify the name you want your grid project to be called and the location where you want to store it's settings on your local harddisk. For the location you may accept the default settings. Then click the Next button.

Select your VO from the list and click the Next button. Or, if you have no VO available in the list, you can create a new one by clicking on the New VO button, selecting the type of VO and clicking the Next button.
Enter the name for your VO, host, port, host DN, Information System Endpoint, and the VO server URL and click the Finish Button. Then select your VO from the list and click Next to get to the last page of this wizard.
Select the referenced project and click the Finish button to complete the new grid project creation. Your newly created project will appear in the "Grid Projects" view panel.
